website_summaries.verdict: A good option for people wanting an affordable Eero setup without the latest advancements.
pros: Large pack of 3 Eero devices provides the same coverage as the more current Pro pack
Works with the Eero app to manage network access on the fly
cons: The large pack can experience certain bugs the newer Eero packages have addressed

customer_reviews.title: You have better choices now
customer_reviews.text: After 4 years of having eero and spent over $ 500 on the product had to junk it because it doesn’t provide the seamless connectivity as advertised. There are many zones where I have a dead signal and after repeated communication with eero support decided to remove the system. When eero first launched it was the best wifi system available but repeated software updates have degraded the performance not improved it.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Nice WiFi - terrible router
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Eero system for seven months. It appears that it is fine for providing a Wi-Fi network, but it has issues as a router. If the Internet connection is lost, and the system is rebooted, it loses all routing capability and the internal LAN is rendered useless. This is unacceptable for a router. Additionally, In a complex network with many devices connected at one time, devices get dropped periodically for no apparent reason. Because of these issues I now use a standalone Araknis router and use the Eeros in bridge mode as access points only. This system is way too expensive to require a separate router.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Use this to replace my Apple AirPort Extreme Base Station
customer_reviews.text: Since I heard the news Apple's leaving the wireless router market, I've decided to give eero a try, as my airport extreme is aging (tech-wise), and I have always want to give the viritual MESH network a try. Not disappointed at all. Have 3 eero place at different part of the home. In the past, I have had slow wireless coverage in the upstairs area, eero's able to extend the coverage in a noticeable manner. Setup is still not as easy as the AirPort Extreme but still better than the Google Onehub. The Eero iOS app is also nice -- I am able to monitor the home network while I am *not* at home and off of the wifi network.
customer_reviews.author: G. C.

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! This product is fabulous. We installed it yesterday in less than 30 minutes. Our balky, ever-bouncing wi-fi is now blazing and consistent throughout our home. A few details if you're wondering about reach and ease: this is a 4,000 sq ft, 3-story home. There are obstacles--steel beams and 1-1/4" of gypcrete on each floor (covering radiant heat). And, we installed it ourselves, guided by the amazingly simple app. "We" are two women, one 66 and the other 59. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: 1st Generation does NOT get 1 GB speeds
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of the Eero system. And for the most part, it does work. However..... The 1GB claim is false, at least with regards to ISP connectivity. After the initial purchase, I was very happy with the system. Once fiber-to-household was made available in our area, my speed jumped to 1 gbps from 15 mbps. The 1st generation eero cannot keep up. Nighthawk, NetGear, and DLink routers will get me the full speed (or at least in the 900+ mbps range), but the Eero struggles to get 500. As I type this, it shows 233 down and 538 up.
customer_reviews.author: Rick R.

customer_reviews.title: Not the end-all
customer_reviews.text: Eero talks as if these are going to be the greatest thing ever. That's just simply not the case. Ultimately, these are just normal wifi access points. They didn't go through everything, like they said they would; they didn't just instantly handle themselves, like they said they would; I ended up having to hardwire all three of mine, and put them into bridge mode to work with my Fiber. Outside of that, they work fine. But, I could have done this with my old Apple WAPs.
customer_reviews.author: JLA76

customer_reviews.title: Easy to repackage for return.
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money. The transmitters simply wouldn't communicate with each other even though I live in a wood frame house. Other Wifi devices had not trouble communicating from the same locations. I'm sure glad Amazon makes returns easy. The only good thing I can say is that the packaging made it really easy to repackage.
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: For once, full house coverage at full speed!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of products, range extenders, and had tried some cheap ones with terrible results. My house is not tiny and has a lot of stone, so I had gaps in my signal, especially in my main office. I had two of three signal bars, but I was only getting around 9MB/sec download. I installed the Eero, which was a LOT easier than I expected (it took me 15 minutes to install three), and after placing them and only wiring one of them to the internet, I went from spotty coverage all over the house with occasional disconnects to a solid 125MB/sec all over the house. So a solid 5-stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Solved all my Wifi woes
customer_reviews.text: Eero finally solved all the wifi issues I had at home. I have tried multiple solutions, including AirPort Extreme + airport express, Almond 3, as well as multiple single router systems from my fiber supplier, and all are great near the access point, but reception in my bedroom has always been bad. Our apartment is not very big, about 95 m2 (1000 sqft) but seems like the walls are pretty solid. I got the 2 pack, one installed in the living room and one in the hallway, and now I am getting the best speeds I have ever had. Very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Metta

customer_reviews.title: Super easy install using downloaded smartphone application
customer_reviews.text: Super easy install using downloaded smartphone application. With two units in our 3000 sq ft house and one unit in our detached garage, I now have almost no degradation in internet speed when using WiFi versus the tower PC hooked directly up to the modem. This is sweet. I like not having to log in to extenders, I had 4 before to get coverage in all rooms and the garage, and the speed was degraded by 50% or more. I don't understand the details of "mesh" technology but it works.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! Before installing this product several months ago we had many issues with our wifi service. We kept replacing our router with no avail. We would lose service in certain rooms of the house, randomly just lose service where we normally have service AND we would lose service while using our microwave (weird?). Since installing this product, we have had uninterrupted service! AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Martasian

customer_reviews.title: Simple and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I can make this review very simple. The Eero system works. Well. We have a sprawling house, and attempts to use either a single router, or a router with extenders, never worked well. Setting up the Eero was easy, and over six months of use, we've never had to even think about the wifi routers. What could be better? It even reaches a gazebo we have in the back yard. Highly recommended if simplicity and consistent utility are the primary goals. I can't speak to whether I could find a faster router system, but several rounds of expensive routers before the Eero did not work as well in covering the entire house.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. McKinney, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Never work for me
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful packing, doesn't work had it installed and running 15 days my best speed was 95/100mb during 3 minutes of the entire 15 days other than those 3min my speed would not go higher than 6mb when lucky. I did all the checks went through every process that eero's web page suggests, even call my ISP went through bridg-mode in my modem did everything, but nothing work, probably got a faulty eero I'll give them the benefit of the doubt since I do see lots of good reviews... but in the end I send it back and currently I happy with my Velop.
customer_reviews.author: Charbel Kuri Jacobo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective -- it just works.
customer_reviews.text: EERO is simple to install (requires a smartphone, either iOS or Android) and works great. This is closest system to approximating distributed wired APs performance-wise that I have found. Unlike mesh systems that use store and forward, there is no hop speed reduction or added latency. It just works! This is my go-to solution now for setting up whole-home wifi systems for clients that want to use their gadgets all over their (usually larger) homes. There's very little in the way of customization that IT geeks like myself might appreciate, but for the vast majority of folks that just want reliable wi-fi, this is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: When Comcast provide better support you know something is wrong
customer_reviews.text: The system is fast and effective when it works. The problem is, I keep getting kicked off the network - over and over and over again. Their tech support works limited West coast hours, and during normal business hours I found myself waiting on the line for 45 minutes or more. When Comcast provide better support you know something is wrong. I've reached a point where I literally have to pull the plug on this system. Like other dissatisfied reviewers I really wanted to like this product, but I just can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MNski

customer_reviews.title: Finally a strong, simple WiFi Network
customer_reviews.text: After two previous failed attempts to resolve the issue of poor WiFi signal in many rooms of our 2000+ square foot home with other products, I was delighted to find that the eero system was quick and easy to set up, and has definitively solved our problem. Instead of having multiple different logins/passwords as was the case with other products, the eero gave me a single, simple login/password combination throughout the house. The range from just 3 eero devices is remarkably good and the signal strength has never wavered.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Garlington

customer_reviews.title: try a different vendor..
customer_reviews.text: wifi keeps dropping out...devices will not connect.....eero app says everthing is fine but its not.....speedtest indicates slow speeds in spots, eero say evertyhing great... not ready for primetime.,...when it works, it works great....when it doesnt, it is really disruptive...
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tower

customer_reviews.title: I took that chance in buying this and am so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: We live in a duplex down condo that was just not being served effectively by our Apple AirPort Extreme. I took that chance in buying this and am so glad I did. Setup was extremely simple - took me less than 15 minutes to get everything up-and-running. We've had no issues with reliability of connection or speed or loss of bandwidth. This blankets our 1800SF with no dead spots. And that's important since my Verizon cell signal won't reach far into the condo, especially downstairs in my office. This allows me to seamlessly connect to the WiFi, affording me the ability to make calls over WiFi on my cell. Absolutely recommend this amazing system!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Tackett

customer_reviews.title: We got Eero due to its glowing reviews and we figured if we weren't happy, we'd spring for the second modem
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about Eero. We were on our last leg with our wi-fi. We live in a big home and our wi-fi signal was very weak in many rooms, including our family room. Most of the time our apple tv wouldn't work. We got Eero due to its glowing reviews and we figured if we weren't happy, we'd spring for the second modem. Eero was so easy to set up. We have three units and they are more than enough for our house, yard, garage to have full signal. So happy, I love this start up, they make a great product.
customer_reviews.author: J mom

customer_reviews.title: Works better than advertised! Must have gear!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the eero system on the recommendation of a co-worker. I had an extended wifi network of several Apple Airports, but was disappointed with the coverage. Have a 3200 sq/ft, concrete block construction, and I'm getting 150/150 Mbps throughout, to include my backyard with eero. All access points are hard wired, which helps but this was same setup I had for Apple network and the performance wasn't anywhere close to eero. Oh yeah, I'm only paying for 75/75 Mbps, so with eero I'm getting double my paid for speeds. With Apple network I was lucky to get 50/50 Mbps. Needless to say, I'm extremely pleased with my eero, and setup was a breeze. This is "must have" gear.
customer_reviews.author: James E. McKay

customer_reviews.title: Struggling with WiFi Issues, Eero Save the Day!
customer_reviews.text: I've been struggling with WiFi issues for many years. Living in a condo and needed some specific network settings I had very limited options. When I heard I can continue to use my router and add WiFi in bridge mode with the eero I knew I had to give it a try. Not only was it easy to setup, but it worked just as expected. Actually better than expected. I like not having to mess with different frequencies and love the app with the daily speed test. I'm justing using one unit as I have a small place, but it's totally worth the investment and I love that I have the ability to expand if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Picune

customer_reviews.title: Overheated - Paper Weight
customer_reviews.text: Within a month (after the Amazon return time-limit), one of the units stopped working completely, and will not longer power on. Tested it with the power supply from the second unit which is still working -- still no power. Clearly something inside burned out. After reading many reviews about all the heat problems with this product, I have no interest in owning anything made by this company. I'm not interested in pursuing the problem with the company, since I do not want a replacement. And since it stopped working about a week after they refund period, I cannot get my money back. Do not buy this product. Find another solution to your home wifi problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Nightlight
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 eero. bought in Jan 2018. no improvement in internet access. my att internet won't recognize Eero either so every morning and night I have to reselect the Eero's connection. My printers won't recognize it either. I am sorry but don't waste your money. It is a nice little night though.
customer_reviews.author: libbydoos

customer_reviews.title: 10 minutes set up and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I've have 3 of these for a while now and, frankly, the system is working so well that I've forgotten that I have it. Previously, various routers and repeaters just didn't' get the job done with the thick plaster walls in my apartment; some were too weak and others won't work with my other equipment despite long, long phen calls to help desks. Eero was up and running in 10 minutes, and then, as I said, I've forgotten there was even a problem. Good buy, I think.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent problems, poor support
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a while, then started having an intermittent issue where the connection would slow to a crawl. This was always fixed by turning my Mac’s WiFi off and back on again. When I contacted support, it took them five days to respond, and then they told me to change my dns settings, which was irrelevant since DNS would work fine when the issue occurred. Replaced it with a $199 system that works great.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Greer

customer_reviews.title: But I was glad to be able to have the flexibility to configure ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to have all kinds of trouble with netgear access points. Flakyness. One of them would sometimes go on the fritz and screw up the Ethernet connection of everything else on the same switch. etc. Since getting these eeros the wifi network has been way more stable and faster. I did have to do some tricky configuration -- I hardwired all three of these APs and am also running them behind a router so you have to put the network in "bridge mode" which removes some functionality. But I was glad to be able to have the flexibility to configure the network as I wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: scottg

customer_reviews.title: Finally.
customer_reviews.text: Using Comcast X1 box. The Wi-Fi from the X1 router is horrible. Drops signal/connections, etc. Hardwiring to the X1 box produces ridiculous speeds. Dissatisfied with X1 Wi-Fi along with other wireless router options, we decided to try the Eero system. One word. Fantastic. Had to play around with proper position for our single level, and long, home. Download speed per Speedtest.net is between 150MB - 220MB, depending on the device. I get service EVERYWHERE in the house, basement, and perimeter outside the home. Best system I have tried yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kollektiv

customer_reviews.title: This is the best purchase I've made in a LONG time
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase I've made in a LONG time. You plug it in, set it up and it just works all the time. We've used it for 1 1/2 yrs now and have never even had to reboot it. We're renting a big 2 story house that had very few cable outlets, which made it hard to set up my home office. This system was basically the same price as paying someone to run cables to the room I wanted to use, but I also get the added benefit of adding wifi coverage to the whole 2nd floor and take the whole thing with me when I leave. I highly recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Still undecided...
customer_reviews.text: The jury is still out on this one. I love the idea of the system, and it seems to have extended the range of my wifi by quite a bit. There are still some serious issues with handoff between antennas and nodes, however. When using my devices (iPhone & iPad) while walking around the house, I am almost always getting booted off the network for a few seconds while it switches nodes. I'm hoping the upcoming 2.20 firmware will fix a lot of these issues. I just hope they release it before my return window closes.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Murray

customer_reviews.title: THE REAL DEAL!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. This is the 'real deal'. You can depend on what you read in reviews and in the promotional stuff. It really works. It really is SUPER EASY to set up. It's expensive. BUT!! - after spending a lot of money on extenders in the past, it's a bargain! Completely eliminated my dead spots - and brought ever corner to 100% speed. The packaging will, alone, give you confidence. Apple quality design and packaging. But - the best part? The mobile app you load (free of course) to do the set up with you Iphone or droid. Amazing - why didn't somebody think of this before?
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: worst WIFI i have used in years
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 Eero's installed and each is wired directly to cat 6. I also have a Verizon WIFI router and an Apple Airport extreme. I planned to retire the other WIFI routers after installing the Eeros. However, the best service I get throughout the house is still with the Airport then the Verizon; the Eeros are by far the worst option. They consistently offer the slowest speeds regardless of location and often drop the connection without warning. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rey

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up, regular software updates from company
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, and I like that the Eero team regularly releases updates to their routers and iPhone app. The latest update shows you which devices are connected to each Eero node, and their signal strength which is incredibly helpful. I think the main thing I'd like to see added is support for connecting a printer or hard drive to the USB port. Right now, Eero says it's only used for "diagnostic purposes"
customer_reviews.author: C & L

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and easy product with a few opportunities for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my Apple AirportExtreme. Family "profiles" make it easy to manage devices. Easy to setup and get running ... as long as you have an iPhone or android device. What I wish: - I wish there was access to any sort of bandwidth prioritization control. - I really wish there was a "default" profile to ensure all unrecognized devices get no access. - I wish there was an admin application that didn't require a smart phone. Why not include either web (ideally) or mac/windows versions?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin White

customer_reviews.title: Almost Gigabit Internet Ready
customer_reviews.text: In my quest to find the MESH WIFI system that could handle the Gigabit Internet, eero did well. The setup was easy and the packaging was great, but it did not score on the speed the same ways as Google Wifi. eero produce about 500 Mbps on average when connected via ethernet, vs Google Wifi at 650. If you are looking to have the smallest profile WIFI this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Benson

customer_reviews.title: The perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing solution for hard to reach areas of a large property. We have a guest house that we needed to get covered by wifi, but didn't want the expense of a hard wired solution, and range extenders couldn't quite get the performance we wanted. This product blankets our property with full strength hi speed connectivity from the garage to the guest house and everywhere in between. Super fast and easy no-brainer setup. Very well thought out product and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: CT FLIER

customer_reviews.title: Great System!
customer_reviews.text: Have tried many different ways of getting WiFi throughout my home, from different brands and cost of routers to numerous range extenders placed throughout my home. They were all only remotely successful. Now I have Eero, and my WiFi has never been better. There's not a dead spot in my home and I get almost full 100mb/s anywhere I go. Eero was simple to set up and the mobile application let's me know the status anywhere, even when I'm at the office. I would highly recommend to anyone to get Eero if you are having difficulty with your WiFi signal.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Life changing! NO more rebooting the wimpy routers! ...
customer_reviews.text: Life changing! NO more rebooting the wimpy routers! We have 4 buildings on our property and it seems to put an umbrella of wifi power over all with one basic wifi service. Our grandson even enjoys his games. Everything is faster. We can't say enough. It is worth every penny!! Thanks Eero!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple Install. Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I've ever had a more simple and easy network installation. Placed two units on the ground floor and one on the second floor. Units do have a distance limitation of 40 ft apart. Follow the install app. Very easy. It's been 9 months now and my Eero network has continued to work flawlessly. One thing I would like to see is a Unit with more Ethernet ports for use in those locations where I still have network equipment that is not wireless, e.g. TiVo, Vonage, UPS, et al.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry102DE

customer_reviews.title: very good and seamless coverage.  lacking some flexibility on configuration
customer_reviews.text: very good and seamless coverage. lacking some flexibility on configuration, but happy to trade that off for stability, reliability and performance update Oct 20th: this is actually one of the few vendors to update the firmware for the KRACK vulnerability that was recently found for all WIFI WPA2 devices. It took them a couple of days. Surprised by their agility and response, this is a product that i would recommend to my friends and family easily. It is a very, very good product. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Best flipping WiFi ever!
customer_reviews.text: The best I've ever had! I've always had problems with updates and firmware for years with all the big brand name "disposable" routers. I call them disposable because that's exactly what they are and I've gone through so many. Finally, Eero has nailed it! I've had the router for months now and it's connectivity is unfailing and superior, and fast! Hallelujah brother that created it! Love the app that works with the router, too. I bought only one because I live in an apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product 9 months ago and can confidently say Eero is an excellent product. Our wifi speeds increased from 40 Mbps to 120mbps with eero being the only variable. The coverage is seemless throughout the house due to the three routers. Purchase an eero for an instant upgrade for you home wifi!
customer_reviews.author: Laura O

customer_reviews.title: It works...
customer_reviews.text: First, I am NOT a techie... When I went home for lunch on Friday, it was there waiting.. Why eat? So, I started the install. Amazing! I only had one small issue so I called tech support.. Boom! issue resolved. Tech support patient and helpful... I elimindate 2 routers and to extenders.. Now I notice how slow my Time Warner is, My decision now is live with slow or spend the $$ to upgrade.. First, find out how much, then make the decision..I am VERY impressed with Erro! Saturday morning, got up to email telling me they upgraded the system overnight... I like that!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: Best Christmas Gift! I researched many options and asked for the eero wifi system for Christmas. It is SO simple to install. I downloaded the app to my iPhone 7 and followed the instructions to set it up. It was fast, easy and working in 20 minutes. Most of the time installing was due to rebooting my modem/router from my cable company. I tested it out by watching Amazon Prime where we had spotty wifi and it it worked like a charm! It's only been 1 day, but so far I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Bell

customer_reviews.title: Best Router System I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best router system I've ever owned. It just works. You don't have to do a bunch of complicated setup in order to get the best wifi performance. It just does any needed adjustments on its own, and the eero gurus are always improving the overall system via various automatically installed updates. I would highly recommend this router system to anyone who wants great wifi performance and doesn't want to mess with the complexity of setting up other router systems that are on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fleener

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! Could they make this any easier??
customer_reviews.text: I compared the latest mesh wifi systems' capabilities, costs, reviews, etc. and decided to try this Eero 2-pack. I needed to cover 2 floors and 2,000/ less sq. feet. As a Prime member, my system arrived with free shipping within one day. The packaging is very sleek and all inclusive. I installed the first unit to my modem and have WiFi on both floors. I'll use the 2nd one if / when needed. I'd say from opening the box and complete setup, it took me ten minutes or less.My prior router-modem setup worked but WiFi dropped sporadically and I need reliable connections for business and personal use. So far, I'm very pleased with this system.
customer_reviews.author: energizer bunny

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product. Even though I have it in Bridge ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. Even though I have it in Bridge Mode because I use Verizon FiOS TV and Internet and I can't take advantage of all of it's features, it does the one thing I wanted. I have WiFi in every corner of my house. No repeaters, which slow the system down or second APs with different SSIDs and the problems that are caused by them. I just put 4 of these around my house and that was it. WiFi cameras with no stutter or pixilization. No more tablets loosing the internet because your in a dead zone. Just awesome, and for me worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marc S

customer_reviews.title: If I could give EERO 6 stars I would - they saved my marriage
customer_reviews.text: If I could give EERO 6 stars I would. These units have transformed our home WiFi from a spotty, erratic experience that was the source of many Friday night movie arguments to a rock solid WiFi experience...wherever we are in our three story house. I no longer have to pretend to be the household network geek and instead can settle down and watch a great movie with the family. Simply put, I cannot stop telling people about these units - every dinner party is an opportunity to transform another family's WiFi experience. I only wished I could have installed them years ago. If you want to really appreciate a connected, Internet of Things household you have to get EERO.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Great. Solved long standing wifi problems in my rance home
customer_reviews.text: Solved my long long standing WIFI problems in ranch home. Could not be more pleased. I still have so so internet from phone company but this made a lot of difficult wifi issues in my home just disappear. Had set up all three units in about 15 minutes. Easy. I am very technical but I love that, with these, I did not need to be. Plus, and big plus, these regularly update the firmware which makes them a lot more secure than the average garden variety wifi router that you need to regularly patch (and no one does because it's a big hassle to do that right).
customer_reviews.author: Quotes&More

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great Wifi coverage, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Finally, no dead spots in my house! I've tried many products to cover my 5000 sp ft two story home, but there were always dead spots. Not any more. after spending about 30 minutes experimenting with locations for my FOUR Eero's, I finally have whole house coverage without any dead spots. It was very easy to set up and requires zero maintenance or updating so far (3 months). It was worth spending nearly $000 to have zero Wifi headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and has worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: My network has never been faster or more reliable. Easy to set up and has worked flawlessly. The app has shown me all devices accessing the network. In short has made wireless in my house wonderful. No dead zones and fast downloads. I highly recommend Eero.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked at how much faster and more reliable our WiFi has been throughout our 3-story house with eero. We've tried so many old-school routers and none of them have done the trick, even after calling out a tech to help "optimize" our settings in the admin. Now, that's all a thing of the past because with eero in my office upstairs we're getting almost 20% faster speeds than the top speeds we ever clocked before, consistently, even in our basement. I can finally play high-end PS4 games online and stream movies with no glitches or waiting. Yeah, eero is expensive, but it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Richey

customer_reviews.title: using my old crappy wireless router (wireless off) as the router
customer_reviews.text: SO when I called to figure out why it wasn't working, I was informed, "yeah, they usually don't work with DSL - it's a real problem and we need to change the website". Ya' think?!? This is what it says on the website: Dual auto-sensing Gigabit ports for WAN (cable or DSL modem) and/or LAN (networked device) Note - DSL. But now I have really fancy repeaters in the bridged mode, using my old crappy wireless router (wireless off) as the router, and most of the 'extra features' don't work. product_meta.title: eero Home WiFi System (Individual) - 1st Generation, 2016
product_meta.description:
Style:Individual



eero is the world’s first whole home WiFi system. A set of three eeros covers the typical home. They work in perfect unison to deliver hyper-fast, super-stable WiFi to every square foot. Stream video, get work done, or swipe right in any room — not just next to your router. It’s simple to set up. Easy to manage. And gets better over time with new features and improved performance. Finally. WiFi that actually works. 

 eero is powered by TrueMesh, the software and mesh routing algorithm at the core of the product. It’s the next generation of wireless mesh technology, custom-built from the ground up to work perfectly with eero. Taking full advantage of the hardware, it means that your WiFi is not only fast and resilient, but also intelligently adapts to your home.





FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




The one router model isn't working 

Relying on a single router is like asking a loud speaker in your living room to provide great sound throughout your home. It’s simple physics: WiFi waves don’t go through walls well and have an even harder time climbing stairs? Ever tried to stream a show from your bedroom when your router’s in the office downstairs? It’s a buffering nightmare. 

To solve this, you need multiple access points — devices that broadcast WiFi — distributed throughout your home. That’s what you’ll find in office buildings, both big and small. But these solutions are out of reach for most of us, and all we’re left with is a band-aid solution: range “extenders,” which don’t live up to their name.



It takes a system 

With eero, you simply plug one device into your modem. Additional eeros only need power from a standard outlet. Powered by TrueMesh, they automatically connect to each other to create a single wireless mesh network that covers your whole home. If you already have Ethernet wiring, you can always choose to hardwire your additional eeros.

Three eeros cover the typical home. You can start with one and eero-up depending on the size of your space. You already pay for high-speed Internet — isn’t it time to get what you’ve paid for in every corner of your home?






Super-simple setup Easier to set up than almost any other gadget in your home, eero is truly frustration-free WiFi. The simple mobile app helps you get your network up and running in minutes.

Easy to manage Manage your entire WiFi network from a simple, intuitive app. See which devices are connected and the speeds you’re clocking. 

Stays new, gets better Automatic software updates that bring new features happen overnight and only take a minute. That means your eero system gets better with time.




Everything you need to know 

In the box: eero WiFi System (individual), power adapter, Ethernet cable, quick start guide 

Processor, memory, and storage: 1.0GHz dual-core processor, 512MB RAM, 4GB flash storage Security and networking services: WPA2 personal wireless encryption, DHCP, NAT, VPN passthrough, UPnP

 Wireless connectivity: Dual-band WiFi radios, simultaneous 2.4GHz and 5GHz wireless, 2x2 MIMO, IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac, Bluetooth Smart Ready

Wired connectivity: Dual auto-sensing Gigabit ports for WAN (cable or DSL modem) and/or LAN (networked device) connectivity, USB 2.0 port 

Electrical and environmental requirements: 100-240V AC, 50-60Hz
feature_bullets: eero is the world’s best-reviewed Whole Home WiFi System that replaces your wireless router and any range extenders. No more dead zones. Now with Alexa Skills.
An individual eero is great if you have a space that's less than 1,000 sq. ft., or as an add-on to an existing eero system.
